qas.question: What type of alcohol is found in beer?
How is alcohol measured in the human body?
What type of alcohol is found in wine and distilled spirits?
What is it called when someone dies from inhaling vomit?
What could be caused by a 0.80% Blood alcohol content in a human?

plausible_answers.text: overall improvement in mood and possible euphoria, increased self-confidence and sociability,

qas.question: What does a BAC of 0.3% - 1.2% typically causes what?

plausible_answers.text: lethargy, sedation, balance problems and blurred vision.

qas.question: What does an ABC of 0.09% to 0.25% cause?

plausible_answers.text: coma (unconsciousness), life-threatening respiratory depression and possibly fatal alcohol poisoning

qas.question: What does an ABC of .35% to 0.80% cause?

context: <b5_0>Beer<b5_0/> contains <a0_0><a2_0>ethyl alcohol<a2_0/><a0_0/>, the same chemical that is present in wine and distilled spirits and as such, beer consumption has short-term psychological and physiological effects on the user. Different concentrations of alcohol in the human body have different effects on a person. The effects of alcohol depend on the amount an individual has drunk, the percentage of alcohol in the beer and the timespan that the consumption took place, the amount of food eaten and whether an individual has taken other prescription, over-the-counter or street drugs, among other factors. Drinking enough to cause a <a1_0><b6_0>blood alcohol concentration<b6_0/><a1_0/> (BAC) of 0.03%-0.12% typically causes an <b7_0>overall improvement in mood and possible euphoria, increased self-confidence and sociability,<b7_0/> decreased anxiety, a flushed, red appearance in the face and impaired judgment and fine muscle coordination. A BAC of 0.09% to 0.25% causes <b8_0>lethargy, sedation, balance problems and blurred vision.<b8_0/> A BAC from 0.18% to 0.30% causes profound confusion, impaired speech (e.g., slurred speech), staggering, dizziness and vomiting. A BAC from 0.25% to 0.40% causes stupor, unconsciousness, anterograde amnesia, vomiting (death may occur due to inhalation of vomit (<a3_0>pulmonary aspiration<a3_0/>) while unconscious and respiratory depression (potentially life-threatening). A BAC from 0.35% to 0.80% causes a <b9_0>coma (unconsciousness), life-threatening respiratory depression and possibly <a4_0>fatal alcohol poisoning<b9_0/><a4_0/>. As with all alcoholic drinks, drinking while driving, operating an aircraft or heavy machinery increases the risk of an accident; many countries have penalties against drunk driving.
